text: This website uses urgent language ('suspended', 'immediate action') to panic the user. Legitimate organizations rarely threaten account deletion via email or landing pages.
The site presents a login form on a suspicious domain. Attackers often clone login pages of popular services (banks, email) to steal credentials.
Requests for sensitive personal information like SSN or Credit Card numbers for 'verification' are a strong indicator of phishing.
This URL mimics PayPal or a financial service. Phishers often use brand names in subdomains (e.g., 'paypal-secure.com') to trick users.
The domain name resembles a legitimate brand but contains typos or extra characters (typosquatting), which is a common technique to deceive users.
The site claims you have won a prize or lottery. These 'too good to be true' offers are classic bait used in phishing campaigns.
The site asks to update payment details to avoid service interruption. This is a common tactic to steal financial information.
Security alerts claiming 'unusual activity' are often used to force users into logging in on a fake page.
